page.title: 01THE WATER TOWER EPPING
page.content: The stately,noble{water tower,}built in 1872 to save Epping from cholera and typhoid, is now being abandoned by a careless public authority.One of the reasons for closing it down was that the pigeons nesting on the ledge of the Gothic windows were dying,falling into the water tank,and polluting it. Earlier this year the pipes were cut off inside,so now it is just a beautiful piece of {Victorian {architecture.} The tank in the top of the tower is made from iron and holds 30,000 gallons of water. Until recently it had been used as an operational depot by a team of six men responsible for Epping's water supply.Now it is {abandoned}like a forgotten old person. The Lee Valley Water Authority wants to sell the whole site,but who will buy a 90 foot towering monument?{
